title: New method insertContentCollectErrors() is added to XCC Java Session Interface.
description:
Starting from 6.0-2, a new method insertContentCollectErrors() is added to XCC Session interface.  Any external class implementing XCC's Java Session interface will need to add implementation for this method in order to compile against the new 6.0-2 XCC jar.  Existing code which references Session interface should continue to work.

Javadoc has been added for the new method as part of the change.  

Danny asked me to file this bug.

support.headline: new method on XCC Session interface causes imcompatibility if you recompile your Java program
support.supportDescription: In 6.0-2, the  insertContentCollectErrors() method was added to the XCC Session interface.  Consequently, code that implements the Session interface but does not implement this new method will fail compilation.
support.workaround: Add the new method to your Session interface before recompiling or use a version of the program compiled with the 6.0-1 or earlier XCC Jar file.

changeHistory.comment:
This is an incompatibity that needs to go in the release notes.  This was added for 19622, so that we can continue when we run into an error.  

Here is some info with a conversation with Jane:

(10:26:48 AM) op_danny_sokolsky: so the 6.0-2 jar will still work in a program compiled with the 6.0-1 jar, but if you recompile then you will need the new jar, is that correct?
(10:27:00 AM) jxchen_us: that's what I believe.
(10:28:22 AM) jxchen_us: well, if you recompile against the new jar, and your client code _implements_ the XCC Java Session interface, you'll need to add the method.
(10:28:29 AM) jxchen_us: in your implementation class.
(10:29:13 AM) jxchen_us: In most common cases, a client only instantiates an XCC session object, but doesn't need to _implement_ their own.
(10:29:33 AM) jxchen_us: XQSync happens to implement its own Session, hence the need to add that method.

I added an incompatibility for this:

http://pubs.marklogic.com:8011/6.0/guide/relnotes/chap4#id_38725
verified this is latest doc on pubs.
